featureSchema.name: Data Persistence
featureSchema.description: Enables stateful behavior by persisting data across requests, simulating a database environment for testing purposes.
featureSchema.userStory: As a tester, I want the mock server to maintain state across multiple requests so that I can simulate database operations.
featureSchema.acceptanceCriteria: The mock server must maintain session state and simulate CRUD operations, returning consistent data across requests.
featureSchema.diagram: Diagram showing stateful interactions with a simulated database within the mock server architecture.
featureSchema.additional: Include options for simulating both transient and durable storage based on the testing scenario.
featureSchema.prompt: Develop a feature that adds data persistence to the mock server. It should be able to maintain state across multiple requests, simulating database-like CRUD operations.
featureSchema.notes: Consider performance overhead and use caching strategies if needed.
